sources.title: Otter.ai's Sam Liang: We can unlock valuable data from meetings and conversations
sources.snippet:
Sam Liang, CEO of Otter.ai, outlines his vision for transforming business productivity through AI-driven meeting transcription and avatar technology. Founded in 2016, Otter.ai has grown from basic voice-to-text services to a comprehensive platform offering live transcription, searchable meeting archives, and AI chat tools. The company's next frontier is customizable AI avatars that can attend and participate in meetings on behalf of users by leveraging vast personal data like documents, emails, and past meeting transcriptions. While still in prototype, these avatars aim to emulate individuals and eventually represent them fully in both internal and customer interactions.

Liang emphasizes Otter‚Äôs proprietary AI and speech recognition technologies, vast meeting data, and platform-agnostic approach, which he believes give it an edge over Big Tech rivals and other start-ups. Otter has 20 million users and operates with a freemium model to penetrate enterprises from the ground up. Security and privacy are key concerns, with encrypted data storage and user-controlled sharing. Despite intensifying competition and concerns over AI ‚Äúhallucinations,‚Äù Liang remains confident in Otter‚Äôs growth, citing improved model accuracy and strong user value, including saving users an average of four hours per week.

citation_mappings.claim_text: Otter.ai ‚Äì Great for meetings, live notes, searchable transcripts. Lindy+1
